latfun.triangular

2D triangular lattice

Useful properties of infinite 2D triangular lattice with nearest neighbours hopping/coupling. Can be used in e.g. tight-binding type models.

Everything is expressed in units of nearest neighbours hopping. By convention, normalized dispersion has a minimum at \(k = 0\) and has the following form

\[E(k_x,k_y) = -2\cos(k_x) - 2\cos\left(\frac{k_x + \sqrt{3}k_y}{2}\right) - 2\cos\left(\frac{k_x-\sqrt{3}k_y}{2}\right)\]

Lattice parameters

BRAVAIS_LATTICE

Hexagonal primitive

N_BANDS

Number of bands = 1

E_MIN

Minimal value of the dispersion = -6

E_MAX

Maximal value of dispersion = 3

BANDWIDTH

Total bandwidth = 9

D_1

Primitive vector \(d_1 = (1,0)\)

D_2

Primitive vector \(d_2 = (\frac{1}{2},\frac{\sqrt{3}}{2})\)

K_1

Primitive vector in reciprocal space \(k_1 = (2\pi,-\frac{2\sqrt{3}}{3}\pi)\)

K_2

Primitive vector in reciprocal space \(k_2 = (0,\frac{4\sqrt{3}}{3}\pi)\)

Functions

disp(kx, ky)

Dispersion relation for 2D triangular lattice (dimensionless)

hsl([n, points])

High symmetry lines (HSL) for 2D triangular lattice
